numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In general, young people are more optimistic than old people.
2. Young people think that the world is getting better with each generation.
3. Very few countries in the chart are below the dividing line.
4. India is below the dividing line.
5. Nigeria is below the dividing line.
6. Morocco is below the dividing line.
7. No country in the chart deviates far to the right and down from the dividing line.
8. Indonesia has a high percentage on both metrics.
9. Brazil has a low percentage on both metrics.
10. Mali has a low percentage on both metrics.
11. I wonder what causes the younger generation to think more optimistically about the future.
12. I wonder why Indonesia is high on both metrics.
13. I wonder why Brazil is low on both metrics.
14. India is a country that is in rapid development.
15. I wonder whether countries that are in rapid development are more likely to be high on the scale.
16. This relates to the United States.
17. In the chart, younger people in the United States are more optimistic than older people in the United States.
18. I do not know what causes this difference.
19. The chart shows a generational divide about what getting better means.
20. The headline is: Your age and your optimism for the world.
